attributes.action: Include at least 1-2 ethnic minorities for almost every jury service
attributes.additional_details: Racial bias has in many cases proven to exist within the jury system. It is unfair for an all white jury to decide if a black or asian man is more likely to commit a crime in comparison to a white counterpart as people can often make a decision based on racial bias. Racial bias is also hard to prove however by having an ethnic minority in a trial especially for a case involving an ethnic minority they can understand what it is like to be stereotyped against & educate the rest of the jury members
attributes.background: Ethnic minorities are often stereotyped against when convicted. Their defence case is also often overlooked due to the bias & stereotypical image SOME jury members already have against them. Many are convicted without solid evidence by an all white jury who have never been stereotyped against.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because we aren't sure what action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take. Equalities legislation would make it  illegal to pick a jury on the basis of race. We're not sure if removing that legislation is something that you would like to see happen.

You could start a new petition calling for all juries to be required to undergo compulsory racial bias training if that's something you would like to see happen.
